information_requirement: Is an adversary modifying critical process control parameters to impair operations?

evidence.description: A parameter modification command sent over an ICS protocol contains an out-of-bounds, unsafe, or statistically anomalous value.
evidence.action: Using Zeek logs with ICS protocol parsers (e.g., modbus.log), parse all 'Write' function codes and their corresponding values. For each critical parameter/register, establish a baseline of normal values (min, max, mean, standard deviation) using historical data. Generate an alert for any new value that falls outside a predefined safe operating envelope or exceeds a statistical threshold (e.g., 3 standard deviations from the mean).

evidence.description: A parameter modification command originates from a network source not authorized to perform control actions, such as a device on the corporate IT network or an unknown IP address.
evidence.action: Maintain an explicit allowlist of authorized IP addresses for Engineering Workstations and HMIs. Monitor Zeek conn.log for any connections to PLCs or RTUs on ICS-specific ports (e.g., destination port 502 for Modbus) originating from IPs not on the authorized list. Correlate these connections with ICS-specific Zeek logs (e.g., modbus.log) to confirm if a parameter 'Write' command was sent from the unauthorized source.

evidence.description: A valid parameter modification is initiated from an authorized Engineering Workstation (EWS) or HMI, but the logon session associated with the action is anomalous.
evidence.action: Correlate the timestamp of a parameter modification event from Zeek ICS logs with successful Windows logon events (Event ID 4624) on the source HMI/EWS. Establish a baseline of authorized users and their typical shift hours. Generate an alert if a parameter change is initiated by a user logged in outside of their normal shift, from a rare geolocation, or from a user account not authorized for process control modifications.

evidence.description: A specific control parameter is modified repeatedly in a short time frame, inconsistent with normal process adjustments or operator actions, potentially indicating an attempt to destabilize the system.
evidence.nai: Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs), Process Control Network (PCN)
evidence.action: For each unique device and parameter combination (e.g., PLC_1, Register_40001), use Zeek ICS logs to track the frequency of 'Write' commands over time. Calculate the rate of change and establish a baseline for this rate. Alert when the frequency of modifications for a single parameter exceeds a statistical threshold (e.g., 99th percentile of modification frequency) within a short time window (e.g., 30 seconds), indicating potential parameter 'flapping'.
